class_notes: Global Health (GH) students only until 11.08.21. This course will meet in person Tuesdays from 1:00 pm - 2:20 pm and will have an additional asynchronous component.
course_description: GH 513 provides an introduction to Community-based Participatory Action Research (CBPAR), and similar research approaches ones that are community-based and community-centered, participatory in their inclusion of community members as protagonists, and action-oriented in the sense that they explicitly seek to promote change. Students will develop familiarity with a range of classical and innovative research approaches, including assets-based approaches such as appreciative inquiry and critical approaches such as autoethnography. The course will be divided roughly in half, with the first half being more instructor-guided and the second half, student-generated and led.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2254, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 1-2:20p, Instructor: Andes/Kaabi, Status: Closed
